ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An incisive and comprehensive survey of fascism and right wing radicalism. It offers clear directives on how to think, analyze, and predict a very relevant political phenomenon. I have taken away a wide array of analytical tools to understand and respond to right wing radical politics. A must for any politically inclined student.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course can benefit from greater logistical and academic planning in terms of assignments and mechanics. This is highly understandable as it was offered by a visiting professor. More intense efforts at effective liaison work may be necessary in the future.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This was a very good course. Good overview of a discipline, and depressingly relevant in 2016
For general interest; anyone interested in the current upsurge of right wing radicalism in world politics should take it.
